strings:
<se_high>Jessica: So this is the famed Goddess statue!
It's pretty impressive.

<se_high>Jessica: This is so...so...so hard to put into words!
It's like...
<se_high>Jessica: HOLY COW!!!

<se_high>Jessica: Er, not that the Goddess is a cow or anything...
It's just a figure of speech! Sorry!
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe they let people like that run the church! It really makes me want to punch something!

<se_high>Jessica: Let's get out of here!
I was enjoying the atmosphere...until they turned up and ruined it!
<se_low>Yangus: Cor! There's a fair few people 'ere, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: Betta watch yer back, guv.
Places full o' tourists like this are always full o' pickpockets an' all.

<se_low>Yangus: That brother of Angelo makes me skin crawl.
One look at 'im an' I feel like I need to 'ave a good scratch!
<se_low>Yangus: I know I don't look it, but I'm a very sensitive bloke, see.

<se_low>Yangus: Oooh! I'm all itchy now!
Yaaaarrgh!

<se_def>Angelo: Have you heard?
The general public aren't allowed to pray to the Goddess statue for salvation.
<se_def>Angelo: Only royals and aristocracy have permission to go inside and pray directly to Her.
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose their kind need more salvation than common folk!

<se_def>Angelo: So he's chummy with High Priest Rolo, is he?
Those two make a very dubious pair.

<se_def>Angelo: What's Marcello up to? ...Hmph!
Whatever it is, it's his problem, not mine.
His affairs are nothing to do with me any more.
<se_def>Angelo: We're no longer...related.
<se_high>Jessica: I know it's supposed to be a holy relic and all, but I don't like visiting the Goddess statue in the middle of the night.
<se_high>Jessica: It seems a bit...scary.

<se_def>Angelo: How about a bit of company during the night then, if you're so scared?
I'll ‘look after’ you. Keep you nice and warm.
<se_high>Jessica: Nice try, Angelo.
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe they let people like that run the church! It really makes me want to punch something!

<se_high>Jessica: Let's get out of here!
I was enjoying the atmosphere...until they turned up and ruined it!

<se_low>Yangus: Ah, night-time!
Me favourite time o' day!
I'm always wide-awake of a night.
<se_low>Yangus: There's no betta time for earnin' a bit of extra dough on the<endash>
<se_low>Yangus: I mean! Er...nuffin'!

<se_low>Yangus: That brother of Angelo makes me skin crawl.
One look at 'im an' I feel like I need to 'ave a good scratch!
<se_low>Yangus: I know I don't look it, but I'm a very sensitive bloke, see.
<se_low>Yangus: Yaaaarrgh! I'm all itchy!
<se_def>Angelo: I'd really rather avoid religious establishments altogether.
<se_def>Angelo: I thought I'd finally put the abbey and all that behind me. Places like this just bring back memories I'd prefer to keep well buried.

<se_def>Angelo: But seeing as we're here, we've got to decide.
We either stay the night, or go back to the ship.

<se_def>Angelo: So he's chummy with High Priest Rolo, is he?
Those two make a very dubious pair.

<se_def>Angelo: What's Marcello up to? ...Hmph!
Whatever it is, it's his problem, not mine.
His affairs are nothing to do with me any more.
<se_def>Angelo: We're no longer...related.
<se_high>Jessica: I suppose Neos is too holy a place for that monster dog to appear.
<se_high>Jessica: But there's something that's been sticking in my mind...

<se_high>Jessica: It's about the Goddess statue.
Something about it doesn't quite sit right with
me.
<se_low>Yangus: Wotever or whoever's possessin' it, it's just a dog we're up against, right? It won't be able to resist a juicy bone then, will it?

<se_low>Yangus: All we gotta do is stick a bit o' meat or fish or somefin' in a trap, an' we'll capture the loopy mutt.<page>Yangus: Anyfin'll do it.
Any grub wot a dog'd like.
<se_low>Yangus: Actually...I'm a bit peckish meself.
<se_def>Angelo: Neither of them are about today...

<se_def>Angelo: Hm? Sorry, just ignore me.
I was only thinking that neither the dog or the Godbird are around, that's all.
<se_high>Jessica: I suppose Neos is too holy a place for that monster dog to appear.
<se_high>Jessica: But there's something that's been sticking in my mind...

<se_high>Jessica: It's about the Goddess statue.
Something about it doesn't quite sit right with
me.
<se_low>Yangus: If that dog can fly, then it means it's got a bit o' bird or somefin' in it, don't it?
<se_low>Yangus: So 'ere's the plan...

<se_low>Yangus: It prob'ly can't see nuffin' at night, like birds can't, right!
So...<page>Yangus: Well, that's about as far as I got wiv the plan so far... But I'm workin' on it!
<se_def>Angelo: Neither of them are about today...

<se_def>Angelo: Hm? Sorry, just ignore me.
I was only thinking that neither the dog or the Godbird are around, that's all.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder if that kid was really serious about becoming a pirate?

<se_high>Jessica: Maybe I should talk to him.
You know. Nip a future problem in the bud.
<se_high>Jessica: Hmm...

<se_low>Yangus: Captain Crow's a pretty famous pirate.
Well 'e was, anyway. He died years ago.
<se_low>Yangus: If I'd 'ad better sea legs on me, maybe I'd o' been Captain Crow the Second, eh!?
<se_def>Angelo: Why do kids' voices always sound so high-pitched and loud?
<se_def>Angelo: It's enough to bring back a man's hangover.
<se_high>Jessica: Ooh, pirate treasure...
<se_high>Jessica: We should find it first. Maybe he'd forget all about wanting to be a pirate if there were no more treasures left to discover.<page>Jessica: What do you think, <hero>?

<se_high>Jessica: I just think kids need to have more realistic dreams about their future.
Something constructive.

<se_low>Yangus: Captain Crow's a pretty famous pirate.
Well 'e was, anyway. He died years ago.

<se_low>Yangus: He must've 'ad some stash o' treasure, eh!?
Cor, it's 'ard not to dribble when ya think about it. But me mum said dribblin's bad manners.

<se_def>Angelo: We're not getting anywhere in our hunt for this dog. A change might do us good.
I say we hunt for the treasure instead.
<se_def>Angelo: Assuming that kid's telling the truth, of course.
<se_high>Jessica: You know, pigeons don't really sound like ‘coo, coo’. Listen more carefully! It's much deeper than that! Like, ‘KHOO! KHOO!’
<se_low>Yangus: When I ain't been able to afford no grub in the past, I 'ave been known to put away a pigeon or a dog 'ere 'n' there.

<se_low>Yangus: But a bullfinch and paprikan shish kebab, now that's good grub!
Yeah, I ain't never tasted better than that!

<se_high>Jessica: Everything looks so tiny from the air.
Even the Goddess statue.

<se_high>Jessica: Is it just me, or does the statue look happier for some reason?
Almost like she's smiling?

<se_high>Jessica: Maybe I'm thinking too much!
It's only a statue, after all!

<se_low>Yangus: Listen, guv! I've got it!
I know why it's 'eaded north!

<se_low>Yangus: I reckon the Lord o' Darkness is more bird than 'e is dog, right.
So I've been thinkin'...

<se_low>Yangus: It must be migratin', eh!?
It's goin' north to go 'ome!
To lay its eggs an' that!

<se_def>Angelo: The Templars will be pulling the strings here before long, too.
...I don't like it.

<se_def>Angelo: Change is all very well, but only if it's a change for the better.
No, I don't like this at all.

<se_high>Jessica: Everything looks so tiny from the air.
Even the Goddess statue.

<se_high>Jessica: Is it just me, or does the statue look happier for some reason?
Almost like she's smiling?

<se_high>Jessica: Maybe I'm thinking too much!
It's only a statue, after all!
<se_low>Yangus: Aaaaah...

<se_low>Yangus: I'm flaggin', guv.
Anyway, it don't look like our mutt's 'round 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: I say we either 'it the sack at the inn, or start lookin' somewhere else. (YAWN!)

<se_def>Angelo: The Templars will be pulling the strings here before long, too.
...I don't like it.

<se_def>Angelo: Change is all very well, but only if it's a change for the better.
No, I don't like this at all.
<se_high>Jessica: Great! So that kid's back on the straight and narrow!
<se_high>Jessica: And it's all thanks to us! Because we found Captain Crow's treasure!
<se_low>Yangus: It's good that we found Captain Crow's 'ideout an' all, but it's a shame Red made off wiv 'alf the treasure.
<se_low>Yangus: Guess there's no chance o' me bein' able to call meself Captain Crow the Second now...
<se_def>Angelo: I never had a chance to play like that.
<se_def>Angelo: Even when my parents were alive, I never had anyone to play with. And after they died, I was too busy praying to think about playing.

<se_def>Angelo: I have to admit, I'm a little jealous of the lad.
Maybe I'll go over and pull his hat over his eyes...

<se_low>Yangus: Me belly's a bit like a zoo, guv.
It's been 'ome to quite a few diff'rent animals over the years.

<se_low>Yangus: But your Munchie... I ain't never seen nuffin' like 'im before.<page>Yangus: It's a bit, er...puzzlin', ain't it?
Needs chewin' over, like.
Ya know, ‘food’ for thought...
<se_low>Yangus: Wot d'ya mean, ‘wot’!? You know wot I'm on about! Don't tell me you ain't thought about it when you was really 'ungry sometime!

<se_def>Angelo: Is it some kind of fashion or something?
This ‘coo, coo’ thing...

<se_high>Jessica: Listen, pigeons go ‘KHOO KHOO’, not ‘coo coo’.
Okey dokey?
<se_low>Yangus: Kuh, I dunno!

<se_low>Yangus: That kid don't know wot really counts, eh!?
It ain't wot noise an animal makes, that's for sure!

<se_low>Yangus: Wot counts is wot it tastes like!
But pigeons ain't got much meat on 'em.
Not worth botherin' wiv, really.
<se_low>Yangus: Mum did used to say all good boys should pray, guv, but we betta be gettin' after that dog before long.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm itchin' to 'ave a bash at the mutt!
Crack! Crunch!
<se_low>Yangus: It's a good idea to get yer weapons an' that in order. An' buyin' some medicinal 'erbs an' stuff's smart thinkin' an' all.<page>Yangus: Just better 'urry, that's all, guv.
<se_low>Yangus: The ugly mutt'll be droolin' over the Lord 'Igh Priest right now, gettin' ready to finish 'im off.<page>Yangus: If we don't get a move on, there won't even be no bones left!

<se_high>Jessica: I don't sense the dog's presence around here.
But still... Something bothers me...

<se_high>Jessica: You know what? I think I'm thinking too much.
Forget what I just said. It's nothing.
<se_high>Jessica: I'm so angry, I can't stop shaking.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't afford to let it strike again!
I won't PERMIT it to strike again!<page>Jessica: No more death and suffering!
We have to stop that damn dog!

<se_def>Angelo: It's too late for prayers now!
Way too late! But go on!
You do whatever it is you want to do!
<se_def>Angelo: You're not really as brave as you look, are you, <hero>?<page>Angelo: You'll never win any battles unless you pluck up a bit more courage, young man!

<se_def>Angelo: To be honest, I don't get the feeling that victory awaits us... It's not fear.
I prefer to call it realism.

<se_def>Angelo: I know we've got to win.
I know that's the only acceptable outcome.
I'm just a bit...tired, that's all.

<se_low>Yangus: This place is packed, eh?
An' ev'ryone's lookin' so 'appy an' all.
We don't belong 'ere.

<se_low>Yangus: An' we're s'posed to be breakin' up this great big ceremony, are we?
Nah, we really don't belong 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: Looks like we could end up in a bit of a bust-up wiv Marcello at some point, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: We better do wotever shoppin' we've gotta do an' get a good night's sleep at the inn, I reckon. Then we'll be ready for anyfin', right?
<se_low>Yangus: Right, guv. Time for the tough to get goin', eh? Come on, let's do the business!

<se_high>Jessica: Marcello's inside that shrine!
Let's get the sceptre back!
Because if we don't... If we don't...er...

<se_high>Jessica: What IS going to happen if we don't?
Well, something bad, that's for sure!
<se_def>Angelo: ...Hm...two-to-one. Those are the odds, assuming we win... We managed to save Jessica, but the other two sceptre-bearers are dead...
<se_def>Angelo: I don't intend to hold back, but...
<se_def>Angelo: ...what if he dies?

<se_low>Yangus: Strike a light!
Even if someone 'ad told me Rhapthorne was in that statue, I wouldn't o' believed 'em.

<se_low>Yangus: He may be big, guv, but your 'eart's bigger!
Bigger an' better!
You'll take 'im to the cleaners!

<se_low>Yangus: An' I'm right behind ya, guv!
Rhapthorne ain't gonna know wot 'it 'im, when the bad boys turn up, eh!?

<se_high>Jessica: I feel like we've been doing everything wrong.
All the heirs to the sages have died, Rhapthorne's back...
<se_high>Jessica: And now the shrine and the entire Holy Isle of Neos have been destroyed.

<se_high>Jessica: Is it really possible to defeat Rhapthorne?
I just don't know any more.
<se_def>Angelo: The remaining guards and Templars will help any survivors. There's no point in us staying here any longer.
<se_def>Angelo: The Lord of Darkness has extended us an invitation, has he not? It wouldn't do to keep him waiting.
<se_low>Yangus: Now the dust's settled, we've got perfect orb-'untin' conditions.
<se_def>Angelo: I don't think we're going to find an orb here. Just try the echo flute if you don't believe me.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's go. We're wasting valuable time.
<se_low>Morrie: This is the first time I am close up and personal with the Goddess statue. I... I...
<se_low>Morrie: I was thinking it would be more full of PASSION and POWER than this, but no.
<se_low>Morrie: Hm, when you travel the world to the famous see-sights, you cannot expect too much, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Hmph, the relazioni are always a bag of worms, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: Look at the starry skies! All the sentinelle!
Si, to take un momento for enjoying the scenery, that is what the travelling is all around, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Hmph, the relazioni are always a bag of worms, ay?

<se_high>Red: Blimey, look at all the people 'ere! I'm tellin' ya, if a flyin' dog swooped down in the middle of
a place like this, ev'ryone'd be goin' bonkers.

<se_high>Red: Nah, that mutt ain't been 'ere, that's for sure.
We better go an' try our luck somewhere else.
<se_low>Morrie: Everything is peaceful here in the Holy Isle, even at a time like this, ay? Si, the Goddess is doing Her thingies.
<se_low>Morrie: But we must face the music and prance! Look danger in the eyes! Summon our GUSTO and leave this safe heaven to search elsewheres!
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha! This young ragazzo has the grandioso dreams, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Fantastico! To find the PASSION so young!
<se_high>Red: Tsk, gettin' uppity about 'ow animals sound? Wot a plonker! Who gives a monkey's?
<se_high>Red: Anyway, if ya wanna get it spot on, you've gotta go an' sit wiv the pigeons for a day or two. That's wot I di<endash> I mean, that's prob'ly the only way, eh?
<se_low>Morrie: No no no! These birds, they say ‘coo coo cumber’. I think they are hungry, ay?
<se_high>Red: The cliff's even more of a whopper than the Goddess statue, eh? I feel like I'm gonna get swallowed up any second, it's so 'ooge!

<se_high>Red: It ain't like Savella Cathedral 'ere, is it?
This place is more... I dunno. It just packs
more of a punch, I s'pose.

<se_low>Morrie: Si... Si, I must make the Moro statue like this.
Morrie Mozzarella, more bigger than the Goddess!
<se_low>Morrie: ...Ah! I, I did not mean to say this in the big voice! Forget my words!

<se_high>Red: Yeah, the old Cap'n Crow, greatest pirate of all time. An' all 'e 'ad in 'is 'oard was a crumpled bit o' paper an' a few measly coins. Nah, there's gotta be more treasure of 'is somewhere about...
<se_high>Red: Once this little adventure's over wiv, I'm gonna get busy and find the bloke's real stash. That's my pension plan, that is.
<se_high>Red: And don't think I'm gonna be sharin' it wiv none o' you lot, either. Cos I ain't!
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha! When I was a young ragazzo, I played pirati, too. I have the patch for the eye, the cappello, the long booties, and the frilly dre<endash>
<se_low>Morrie: Ahem! But, but I do not like to do the dressing up now. Now I am a groaning man, ay?
<se_high>Red: Wot are you playin' at? How about tearin' yer eyes away from that Goddess statue for a minute and lookin' at where the leaf is on the map, eh?
<se_high>Red: It ain't no use prayin' now. We've just gotta roll our sleeves up an' get stuck in!
<se_high>Red: We lost that cos we weren't tough enough. No two ways about it, unfortunately.
<se_high>Red: But we're on the up, eh? Gettin' tougher all the time. So it ain't gonna go that way next time, right? We're gonna teach that mutt a lesson!

<se_low>Morrie: Si... Si, I must make the Moro statue like this.
Morrie Mozzarella, more bigger than the Goddess!
<se_low>Morrie: ...Ah! Scusi! I must stop planning my enorme erezione, ay? Si, we must chase after the black canine!
<se_low>Morrie: No! How can we lose?

<se_low>Morrie: But Moro Mozzarella never says dying!
We do our preparativi and fight the beast again. Si, revenge is a sweet, and we suck hard, ay?
<se_high>Red: So we've gotta 'ave an argy-bargy wiv Marcello when all this is goin' on, eh?
<se_high>Red: Heh heh, no sweat. I always did like causin' a scene at a party!
<se_low>Morrie: Magnifico! See the GUSTO in these celebrazioni! The brave people looking forward to the future, not back to the pasts.
<se_low>Morrie: But the future is a picture black unless we can turn things around, ay? We must do everything we can! Pull out all of the spots!
<se_high>Red: Blimey, that's a turn up for the books. Who'd o' thought the Lord o' Darkness would be 'idin' away inside the Goddess statue?
<se_high>Red: That's some dark poetry, innit, eh? All them people prayin' to the Goddess, an' they were really prayin' to Rhapthorne!

<se_low>Morrie: The red sky, the castello flying in the clouds...
Si, it is like the end of a grandioso fairy's tale, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe the Goddess has discovered that I try to carve my own face into the rocks on the behind of the statue...? Mamma mia! Is Moro Mozzarella going to the Inferno!?
<se_high>Red: I don't reckon Neos is ever gonna be the same again, eh? Even if we do knock Rhapthorne off 'is perch, the Goddess statue ain't comin' back, is it?
<se_high>Red: But maybe it'll be a better place anyway. Prettier than before, an' more full o' life than ever, I reckon. Heh heh, yeah, I'm lookin' forward to it.
<se_low>Morrie: I like to be high. To feel the POWER of the wind. But when I see this enorme hole, it takes the wind from my snails.
<se_low>Morrie: It is an hole with no end, ay? Like the mouth of a gigante monster, waiting to goblin you up, si?

<se_low>Yangus: Strike a light!
Even if someone 'ad told me Rhapthorne was in that statue, I wouldn't o' believed 'em.

<se_low>Yangus: He may be big, guv, but your 'eart's bigger!
Bigger an' better!
You'll take 'im to the cleaners!

<se_low>Yangus: An' I'm right behind ya, guv!
Rhapthorne ain't gonna know wot 'it 'im, when the bad boys turn up, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: It's 'ard to put that Rhapthorne geezer out yer mind, ain't it, wot wiv 'im 'angin' over our 'eads all the while. But I can't 'elp wond'rin' about that place wot Jessica said she saw.
<se_low>Yangus: A skeleton of a dragon in the desert's gotta be the place south of Argonia, right? That Dragon Graveyard place. I always said it was dodgy.

<se_low>Yangus: Strike a light!
Even if someone 'ad told me Rhapthorne was in that statue, I wouldn't o' believed 'em.

<se_low>Yangus: He may be big, guv, but your 'eart's bigger!
Bigger an' better!
You'll take 'im to the cleaners!

<se_low>Yangus: An' I'm right behind ya, guv!
Rhapthorne ain't gonna know wot 'it 'im, when the bad boys turn up, eh!?

<se_high>Jessica: I feel like we've been doing everything wrong.
All the heirs to the sages have died, Rhapthorne's back...
<se_high>Jessica: And now the shrine and the entire Holy Isle of Neos have been destroyed.

<se_high>Jessica: Is it really possible to defeat Rhapthorne?
I just don't know any more.
<se_high>Jessica: You're worried about me? Thanks, that's sweet. But I'm fine, really.
<se_high>Jessica: I just can't forget about that place I had a vision of. I'm sure it's got something to do with Rhapthorne, I just don't know what yet.

<se_high>Jessica: I feel like we've been doing everything wrong.
All the heirs to the sages have died, Rhapthorne's back...
<se_high>Jessica: And now the shrine and the entire Holy Isle of Neos have been destroyed.

<se_high>Jessica: Is it really possible to defeat Rhapthorne?
I just don't know any more.
<se_def>Angelo: The remaining guards and Templars will help any survivors. There's no point in us staying here any longer.
<se_def>Angelo: The Lord of Darkness has extended us an invitation, has he not? It wouldn't do to keep him waiting.
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose we shouldn't be surprised that Jessica had some kind of premonition. She was under the curse of the sceptre, after all.
<se_def>Angelo: Granted, it's a little out of our way, but I say we go and see exactly what's what at the Dragon Graveyard before something happens that makes it impossible to go.
<se_def>Angelo: The remaining guards and Templars will help any survivors. There's no point in us staying here any longer.
<se_def>Angelo: The Lord of Darkness has extended us an invitation, has he not? It wouldn't do to keep him waiting.
<se_high>Red: I don't reckon Neos is ever gonna be the same again, eh? Even if we do knock Rhapthorne off 'is perch, the Goddess statue ain't comin' back, is it?
<se_high>Red: But maybe it'll be a better place anyway. Prettier than before, an' more full o' life than ever, I reckon. Heh heh, yeah, I'm lookin' forward to it.
<se_high>Red: It's one myst'ry after another at the minute, eh? Blimey, it's a good job I ain't of a nervous disposition.
<se_high>Red: Anyway, I say we better 'ead over to that Dragon Graveyard place and nip wotever myst'ry's waitin' there for us in the bud.
<se_high>Red: I don't reckon Neos is ever gonna be the same again, eh? Even if we do knock Rhapthorne off 'is perch, the Goddess statue ain't comin' back, is it?
<se_high>Red: But maybe it'll be a better place anyway. Prettier than before, an' more full o' life than ever, I reckon. Heh heh, yeah, I'm lookin' forward to it.
<se_low>Morrie: I like to be high. To feel the POWER of the wind. But when I see this enorme hole, it takes the wind from my snails.
<se_low>Morrie: It is an hole with no end, ay? Like the mouth of a gigante monster, waiting to goblin you up, si?

<se_low>Morrie: Fantastico! Our bimba can see to the future as well as make the powerful magic, ay? What a magnifico pair...of skills.
...Che? No?
<se_low>Morrie: Ah. Scusi. Well, er, we must listen to bimba's words, and make the tricks in the desert, si? Allora, we go!
<se_low>Morrie: I like to be high. To feel the POWER of the wind. But when I see this enorme hole, it takes the wind from my snails.
<se_low>Morrie: It is an hole with no end, ay? Like the mouth of a gigante monster, waiting to goblin you up, si?
<se_high>Red: Blimey, that's a turn up for the books. Who'd o' thought the Lord o' Darkness would be 'idin' away inside the Goddess statue?
<se_high>Red: That's some dark poetry, innit, eh? All them people prayin' to the Goddess, an' they were really prayin' to Rhapthorne!
<se_high>Red: It's one myst'ry after another at the minute, eh? Blimey, it's a good job I ain't of a nervous disposition.
<se_high>Red: Anyway, I say we better 'ead over to that Dragon Graveyard place and nip wotever myst'ry's waitin' there for us in the bud.
<se_high>Red: Blimey, that's a turn up for the books. Who'd o' thought the Lord o' Darkness would be 'idin' away inside the Goddess statue?
<se_high>Red: That's some dark poetry, innit, eh? All them people prayin' to the Goddess, an' they were really prayin' to Rhapthorne!

<se_low>Morrie: The red sky, the castello flying in the clouds...
Si, it is like the end of a grandioso fairy's tale, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe the Goddess has discovered that I try to carve my own face into the rocks on the behind of the statue...? Mamma mia! Is Moro Mozzarella going to the Inferno!?

<se_low>Morrie: Fantastico! Our bimba can see to the future as well as make the powerful magic, ay? What a magnifico pair...of skills.
...Che? No?
<se_low>Morrie: Ah. Scusi. Well, er, we must listen to bimba's words, and make the tricks in the desert, si? Allora, we go!
